results.title: Literature review of the clinical characteristics of metformin-induced hepatotoxicity
results.text_hl: The MeSH terms and keywords were the following: @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@, hypoglycemic agents, @DISEASE_Chemical_and_Drug_Induced_Liver_Injury @DISEASE_MESH:D056486 @@@hepatitis@@@, hepatotoxicity, @<m>DISEASE_Jaundice</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D007565 @@@jaundice@@@, @DISEASE_Liver_Failure @DISEASE_MESH:D017093 @@@liver injury@@@, @DISEASE_Pruritus @DISEASE_MESH:D011537 @@@pruritus@@@, @DISEASE_Cholangitis @DISEASE_MESH:D002761 @@@cholangitis@@@, and @DISEASE_Cholestasis @DISEASE_MESH:D002779 @@@cholestasis@@@.

citations.NLM: Wang C, Deng H, Xu Y, Liu Y. Literature review of the clinical characteristics of metformin-induced hepatotoxicity Front Pharmacol. 2022;13():969505. PMID: 36147344
citations.BibTeX: @article{36147344, title={Literature review of the clinical characteristics of metformin-induced hepatotoxicity}, author={Wang C and Deng H and Xu Y and Liu Y}, journal={Front Pharmacol}, volume={13}, pages={969505}}

results.title: A randomised placebo-controlled trial of the effectiveness of early metformin in addition to usual care in the reduction of gestational diabetes mellitus effects (EMERGE): study protocol
results.text_hl: Non-adherence rate of 8% in the @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ group

results.title: A meta-analysis of metformin and insulin on maternal outcome and neonatal outcome in patients with gestational diabetes mellitus.
results.text_hl: A meta-analysis of @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ and @GENE_INS @GENE_3630 @@@insulin@@@ on maternal outcome and neonatal outcome in @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with @DISEASE_Diabetes_Gestational @DISEASE_MESH:D016640 @@@gestational diabetes mellitus@@@.

results.title: Cholestatic jaundice associated with the use of metformin.
results.text_hl: Given the onset of his @<m>DISEASE_Jaundice</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D007565 @@@jaundice@@@ 2 wk after the initiation of @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@, we believe that this case represents an example of @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@-associated hepatotoxicity, the first such case reported.

citations.NLM: Desilets DJ, Shorr AF, Moran KA, Holtzmuller KC. Cholestatic jaundice associated with the use of metformin. Am J Gastroenterol. 2001 Jul;96(7):2257-8. PMID: 11467664
citations.BibTeX: @article{11467664, title={Cholestatic jaundice associated with the use of metformin.}, author={Desilets DJ and Shorr AF and Moran KA and Holtzmuller KC}, journal={Am J Gastroenterol}, volume={96}, number={7}, pages={2257-8}}

results.title: Metformin-Induced Hemolytic Anemia
results.text_hl: Drug-induced @DISEASE_Anemia_Hemolytic @DISEASE_MESH:D000743 @@@hemolytic anemia@@@ was suspected and @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ was discontinued, after which the @<m>DISEASE_Jaundice</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D007565 @@@jaundice@@@ disappeared in 3-4 days and therefore there was no requirement for RBC transfusions (fig 1).

citations.NLM: Kirkiz S, Yarali N, Arman Bilir O, Tunc B. Metformin-Induced Hemolytic Anemia Med Princ Pract. 2014;23(2):183-5. PMID: 24296614
citations.BibTeX: @article{24296614, title={Metformin-Induced Hemolytic Anemia}, author={Kirkiz S and Yarali N and Arman Bilir O and Tunc B}, journal={Med Princ Pract}, volume={23}, number={2}, pages={183-5}}

results.title: Possible metformin-induced hepatotoxicity.
results.text_hl: METHODS: After receiving @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ 500 mg/d for 3 weeks, a 73-year-old Japanese @SPECIES_9606 @@@woman@@@ weighing 33.5 kg with poorly controlled @DISEASE_Myotonic_Dystrophy @DISEASE_MESH:D009223 @@@DM-2@@@ presented with @DISEASE_Fatigue @DISEASE_MESH:D005221 @@@fatigue@@@, @<m>DISEASE_Jaundice</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D007565 @@@jaundice@@@, @DISEASE_Nausea @DISEASE_MESH:D009325 @@@nausea@@@, @DISEASE_Vomiting @DISEASE_MESH:D014839 @@@vomiting@@@, @DISEASE_Anorexia @DISEASE_MESH:D000855 @@@anorexia@@@, and @DISEASE_Abdominal_Pain @DISEASE_MESH:D015746 @@@abdominal pain@@@.

citations.NLM: Kutoh E. Possible metformin-induced hepatotoxicity. Am J Geriatr Pharmacother. 2005 Dec;3(4):270-3. PMID: 16503324
citations.BibTeX: @article{16503324, title={Possible metformin-induced hepatotoxicity.}, author={Kutoh E}, journal={Am J Geriatr Pharmacother}, volume={3}, number={4}, pages={270-3}}

results.title: Metformin-induced cholestatic hepatitis.
results.text_hl: The dosage initially was 500 mg twice daily and later was increased to 850 mg twice a day. Four weeks after @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@met-formin@@@ treatment was initiated, @<m>DISEASE_Jaundice</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D007565 @@@jaundice@@@, @DISEASE_Pruritus @DISEASE_MESH:D011537 @@@pruritus@@@, and @DISEASE_Chemical_and_Drug_Induced_Liver_Injury @DISEASE_MESH:D056486 @@@liver enzyme abnormalities@@@ were noted.

citations.NLM: Nammour FE, Fayad NF, Peikin SR. Metformin-induced cholestatic hepatitis. Endocr Pract. 2003 Jul-Aug;9(4):307-9. PMID: 14561576
citations.BibTeX: @article{14561576, title={Metformin-induced cholestatic hepatitis.}, author={Nammour FE and Fayad NF and Peikin SR}, journal={Endocr Pract}, volume={9}, number={4}, pages={307-9}}

results.text_hl: Fatal @DISEASE_Anemia_Hemolytic @DISEASE_MESH:D000743 @@@hemolytic anemia@@@ associated with @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@: A case report

results.title: Metformin-induced mixed hepatocellular and cholestatic hepatic injury: case report and literature review
results.text_hl: He had also had @DISEASE_Pruritus @DISEASE_MESH:D011537 @@@pruritus@@@ and @<m>DISEASE_Jaundice</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D007565 @@@jaundice@@@ for 8 days. @DISEASE_Myotonic_Dystrophy @DISEASE_MESH:D009223 @@@DM-2@@@ had been recently diagnosed and @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ 850 mg/day had been initiated 2 weeks before presentation to the hospital.

citations.NLM: Saadi T, Waterman M, Yassin H, Baruch Y. Metformin-induced mixed hepatocellular and cholestatic hepatic injury: case report and literature review Int J Gen Med. 2013;6():703-6. PMID: 23983487
citations.BibTeX: @article{23983487, title={Metformin-induced mixed hepatocellular and cholestatic hepatic injury: case report and literature review}, author={Saadi T and Waterman M and Yassin H and Baruch Y}, journal={Int J Gen Med}, volume={6}, pages={703-6}}
